page.title: 03Hodthorpe and Belph
page.content: The other village in our area is Hodthorpe which is less than half the size of Whitwell.The population of Hodthorpe has remained static in the last ten years. There is only one public house which is a Working Mens Club Hodthorpe was built at the same time as the pit was.Most of the land in Hodthorpe belonged to Welbeck Abbey. The facilities in Hodthorpe have declined in the past thirty years, as there used to be six General Stores and now there is only one shop and a Post Office. Unlike Whitwell which has much modern development, there has been little recent building in Hodthorpe.There is a certain amount of rivalry between two villages,and both like to retain their identity. The other settlement in the grid is at Belph where there is a group of six cottages.
